resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/106933</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>106933</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086746</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">PLoS Pathogens</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">PLoS Krankheitserreger</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Microbes pathogènes de PLoS</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Pathogens De PLoS</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Agenti patogeni Di PLoS</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">PLoS παθογόνα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Patógeno De PLoS</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">From molecules to physiology, PLoS Pathogens publishes important new ideas on bacteria, fungi, parasites, prions, and viruses that contribute to our understanding of the biology of pathogens and pathogen-host interactions.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Von Moleküle zu Physiologie, veröffentlicht PLoS 
Krankheitserreger wichtige neue Ideen auf Bakterium, Pilzen, 
Parasiten, prions und Viren, die zu unserem Verständnis der Biologie 
der Krankheitserreger und der Krankheitserreger-Hauptrechner 
Interaktionen beitragen.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Des molécules à la physiologie, les microbes 
pathogènes de PLoS édite de nouvelles idées importantes sur des 
bactéries, des mycètes, des parasites, des prions, et des virus
qui contribuent à notre arrangement de la biologie des microbes 
pathogènes et des interactions de microbe-centre serveur.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Das moléculas ao physiology, os pathogens de PLoS 
publicam idéias novas importantes nas bactérias, nos fungos, nos 
parasites, nos prions, e nos vírus que contribuem a nossa 
compreensão da biologia dos pathogens e das interações do 
pathogen-anfitrião.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Dalle molecole alla fisiologia, gli agenti patogeni
di PLoS pubblica le nuove idee importanti sui batteri, sui funghi, sui
parassiti, sui prions e sui virus che contribuiscono alla nostra 
comprensione della biologia degli agenti patogeni e delle interazioni 
del agente-calcolatore centrale.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Από τα μόρια στη φυσιολογία, τα παθογόνα PLoS 
δημοσιεύουν τις σημαντικές νέες ιδέες σχετικά με τα βακτηρίδια, 
τους μύκητες, τα παράσιτα, τα prions, και τους ιούς που 
συμβάλλουν στην κατανόησή μας της βιολογίας των παθογόνων και των
αλληλεπιδράσεων παθογόνο-ξένιου χ/υ.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">De las moléculas a la fisiología, los patógeno 
de PLoS publican nuevas ideas importantes en bacterias, hongos, 
parásitos, prions, y los virus que contribuyen a nuestra comprensión
de la biología de patógeno y de interacciones del 
pato'geno-ordenador principal.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086746</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>LRE.roleMetaValues</source>
              <value>provider</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
VERSION:3.0
N:OERCommons
FN:OERCommons
ORG:OERCommons
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="x-t-cc-url">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/</string>
            <string language="en">Creative Commons Attribution 2.5</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>106933</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/libraries/plos-pathogens</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
